__TOC__


Ubuntu releases are supported for 18 months. Ubuntu LTS (Long Term Support) releases are supported for 3 years on the desktop, and 5 years on the server.
== Team ==
See ReleaseTeam
== Schedule ==
Ubuntu releases every six months (Last release on 28 April 2011)(see TimeBasedReleases).
* Release Schedules: http://wiki.ubuntu.com/ReleaseSchedule

== Variants of Ubuntu ==

* <nowiki>[[Kubuntu]]</nowiki> (Ubuntu with KDE instead of Gnome)
* <nowiki>[[Edubuntu]]</nowiki> (Ubuntu focused on education)
* <nowiki>[[Xubuntu]]</nowiki> (Ubuntu with XFCE instead of Gnome)
* <nowiki>[[UbuntuStudio]]</nowiki> (Ubuntu focused on multimedia production)
* <nowiki>[[Mythbuntu]]</nowiki> (Xubuntu-based XFCE4 desktop OS with MythTV installed)
* <nowiki>[[Lubuntu]]</nowiki> (Ubuntu with LXDE instead of Gnome (Unofficial))
* <nowiki>[[Cobuntu]]</nowiki> (Ubuntu-based OS, optimized for Korean users (Unofficial))
* <nowiki>[[Runtu]]</nowiki> (Ubuntu-based OS, optimized for Russian users (Unofficial))
* <nowiki>[[http://www.sabily.org|Sabily]]</nowiki> (Ubuntu-based OS, customized for Muslim users (Unofficial))
* <nowiki>[[Gobuntu]]</nowiki> (Ubuntu-base for other free software platforms (Historical))
